TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit TextPatternIdentifiers extends System.Object
public ref class TextPatternIdentifiers abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Contains values used as identifiers for .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> exposes detailed information of the textual contents of objects such as edit controls and documents.
UI Automation providers should be written so that they can work in a partial-trust environment. Because UIAutomationClient.dll is not configured for full trust, your provider code should not reference that assembly. If it does so, the code may run in a full-trust environment but then fail in a partial-trust environment.
In particular, do not use fields from classes in UIAutomationClient.dll such as those in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>. Instead, use the equivalent fields from classes in UIAutomationTypes.dll, such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementIdentifiers>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly AnimationStyleAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Animations appear on the screen only; the animated text prints, but the animation effect does not.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.None>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly BackgroundColorAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the BackgroundColor attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly BulletStyleAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.None>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly CapStyleAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.None>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly CultureAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the Culture () attribute of a text range down to the sub-language level; for example, French-Switzerland (fr-CH) instead of French (fr).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
See <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> for more detail on the language code format.
The default value is the language of the application user interface.
> [!NOTE] > There might be cases where the server does not support the language tag or authors cannot use it. In those cases the default applies.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly FontNameAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the FontName attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Examples include "Arial Black" and "Arial Narrow".
Values are non-localized.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.String>.
The default value is an `empty string`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly FontSizeAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the FontSize attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly FontWeightAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the FontWeight attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Refers to the relative stroke, thickness or boldness of a font.
This is modeled after the `lfWeight` field in GDI LOGFONT. For consistency, the following values have been adopted from LOGFONT: 0=DontCare, 100=Thin, 200=ExtraLight or UltraLight, 300=Light, 400=Normal or Regular, 500=Medium, 600=SemiBold or DemiBold, 700=Bold, 800=ExtraBold or UltraBold, and 900=Heavy or Black.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly ForegroundColorAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the ForegroundColor (COLORREF) attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Foreground color is equivalent to the text or font color.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly HorizontalTextAlignmentAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The horizontal text alignment applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment>
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment.Left>

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly IndentationFirstLineAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the IndentationFirstLine () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The first-line indentation (specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit.Point> unit type value) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.

Docs.summary: Identifies the IndentationTrailing () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:

This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.

Docs.summary: Identifies the IsHidden attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly IsReadOnlyAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the IsReadOnly attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The read-only state of the document associated with the calling text range.
> [!NOTE] > If a document or file is read-only, but you can still edit it and save it as another file, the text is not considered read-only.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly MixedAttributeValue As Object

Docs.summary: Identifies whether the value of a given attribute varies over a text range in a rich edit control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A> returns `TextPattern.MixedAttributeValue` to indicate this variation instead of a collection of attribute values.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Object>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly TabsAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the Tabs attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection of tab stops has each tab stop specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit.Point> unit type value.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are an array of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is an `empty` array.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent TextChangedEvent
Public Shared ReadOnly TextChangedEvent As AutomationEvent

Docs.summary: Identifies the event raised whenever textual content is modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
## Examples [!code-csharp[UIATextPattern_snip#1052](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/CSharp/SearchWindow.cs#1052)]
[!code-vb[UIATextPattern_snip#2052](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATextPattern_snip/VisualBasic/SearchWindow.vb#2052)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly TextFlowDirectionsAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the TextFlowDirections () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections>.
The default value is the bitwise combination of the following values: <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections.Vertical> `|` <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections.RightToLeft> `|` <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections.BottomToTop>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent TextSelectionChangedEvent
Public Shared ReadOnly TextSelectionChangedEvent As AutomationEvent

Docs.summary: Identifies the event raised whenever the text selection is modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Some text controls handle the text insertion point (cursor) as a zero-width text selection and might raise `TextSelectionChangedEvent` when the cursor is moved.
> [!NOTE] > To follow cursor movements, UI Automation clients are advised to keep track of insertion point changes by listening for corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element events rather than depending on <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.TextSelectionChangedEvent>.
This identifier is used by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] providers. Client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly UnderlineColorAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the UnderlineColor attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly UnderlineStyleAttribute As AutomationTextAttribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the UnderlineStyle () attribute of a text range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation providers. UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle.None>.
